meta.title: Athena Python PPTX - Extended API Reference
meta.description: Documentation for Athena-specific functions not available in python-pptx

functions.name: render
functions.signature: (format: str = 'png', scale: int = 2, as_pil: bool = False)
functions.summary: Render the slide to an image.

params.name: scale
params.description: Render scale factor (default 2x for high resolution)

params.name: as_pil
params.description: If True, return a PIL.Image.Image object instead of bytes. Requires the Pillow library to be installed.

functions.returns: bytes: PNG image data (if as_pil=False) PIL.Image.Image: PIL Image object (if as_pil=True)

raises.description: If an unsupported format is specified
If as_pil=True but Pillow is not installed

examples:
# Get raw PNG bytes
png_bytes = slide.render()
with open("slide.png", "wb") as f:
    f.write(png_bytes)

# Get PIL Image (requires Pillow)
img = slide.render(as_pil=True)
img.save("slide.png")
img.show()  # Display the image

# High resolution render
img = slide.render(scale=4, as_pil=True)
notes: This method is Athena-specific and not available in python-pptx.

functions.name: clone
functions.description: Clone slide with all its content
functions.summary: Clone this slide with all its content.

params.name: target_index
params.description: Zero-based index where the clone should be inserted. If None, the clone is inserted immediately after this slide.

functions.returns: Slide: The newly created slide object.
examples:
# Clone slide and insert after it
new_slide = slide.clone()

# Clone slide and insert at beginning
new_slide = slide.clone(target_index=0)

# Clone slide and insert at end
new_slide = slide.clone(target_index=len(prs.slides))
notes: This method is Athena-specific and not available in python-pptx.

functions.name: delete_slides
functions.description: Delete multiple slides at once by index
functions.summary: Delete multiple slides from the presentation by their indices.

params.name: indices
params.description: List of zero-based slide indices to delete

raises.description: If any index is out of range

examples:
# Delete slides at indices 1, 3, and 5
prs.slides.delete_slides([1, 3, 5])

# Delete the last two slides
prs.slides.delete_slides([len(prs.slides) - 1, len(prs.slides) - 2])
notes: This method is Athena-specific and not available in python-pptx.

functions.name: keep_only
functions.description: Keep only specified slides, removing all others
functions.summary: Keep only the slides at the specified indices, deleting all others.

params.name: indices
params.description: List of zero-based slide indices to keep

raises.description: If any index is out of range

examples:
# Keep only the first and last slides
prs.slides.keep_only([0, len(prs.slides) - 1])

# Keep only slide at index 2
prs.slides.keep_only([2])
notes: This method is Athena-specific and not available in python-pptx. The order of indices does not affect the final slide order - slides maintain their relative positions.
